sen.j: 平 有盛（たいら の ありもり）は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Arimori was busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of Heian period.
TAIRA no Arimori was a busho (a Japanese military commander) lived in the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: 武将に冠詞を加え，時代の前置詞をinに変更，livedを追加しました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Arimori was a busho (a Japanese military commander) lived during the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: in→during

sen.e: He was the forth son of TAIRA no Shigemori.
He was the forth son of TAIRA no Shigemori.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was the forth son of TAIRA no Shigemori.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 母は正室の藤原経子 (藤原家成の四女)。
sen.e: His mother was seishitsu (legal wife) FUJIWARA no Keishi (the forth daughter of FUJIWARA no Ienari).
His mother was FUJIWARA no Keishi (the forth daughter of FUJIWARA no Ienari), the legal wife of Shigemori.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: His mother was FUJIWARA no Keishi (the forth daughter of FUJIWARA no Ienari), the legal wife of Shigemori.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官位は従四位下右近衛権少将。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and Ukone no Gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
His official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and Ukonoe no Gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 右近衛の訳は"Ukonoe"と思われます。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and Ukonoe no Gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 異母兄の平資盛に従い、三草山の戦いに参戦。
sen.e: He followed his paternal half-brother TAIRA no Sukemori and participated in Battle of Mikusayama.
Accompanying his paternal half-brother TAIRA no Sukemori, he participated in the Battle of Mikusayama.
sen.cmt: 戦に冠詞を加えました。「従い・・」の訳を替えました。
sen.e: Accompanying his paternal half-brother TAIRA no Sukemori, he participated in the Battle of Mikusayama.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 源義経に敗れた後は、屋島の平家本陣に落ち延びた。
sen.e: After being defeated by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, they escaped to Heike honjin (the camp of a supreme commander) in the Yashima peninsula.
After being defeated by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, they evacuated to the headquarters of the Heike clan in the Yashima peninsula.
sen.cmt: 本陣の説明がわかりづらいと考え変更しました。
sen.e: After being defeated by MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, they evacuated to the headquarters of the Heike clan in the Yashima peninsula.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 最後は壇ノ浦の戦いにおいて、資盛、従兄弟の平行盛と三名で手を取り合い、海中に身を投じた。
sen.e: Eventually, at the Battle of Dannoura, he, Sukemori and his cousin TAIRA no Yukimori drowned themselves in the sea together.
He died in the Battle of Dannoura. He, Sukemori and his cousin TAIRA no Yukimori drowned themselves in the sea, hand in hand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「最後は」をeventuallyで訳すのは不自然かと思われます。「手を取り合い」をtogetherよりも具体的に表現しました。
sen.e: In the end, he drowned himself in the sea with Sukemori and his cousin TAIRA no Yukimori, hand in hand, in the Battle of Dannoura.
sen.cmt: 原文を分割する必要はないので一文にしました。

sen.e: He died at the age of twenty-two.
He was 22-year-old at the time.
sen.cmt: 文の流れから書き換えました。
sen.e: He was 22-year-old at the time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 原文の「伝説」は民間伝承と考えられるので変更しました。

sen.j: 奄美諸島には資盛、行盛、有盛が落ち延びたという平家の落人伝説がある。
sen.e: In the Amami Islands, the folklore of fleeing Heike warriors has it that Sukemori, Yukimori and Arimori escaped alive.
In the Amami Islands, there is folklore of fleeing Heike warriors saying that Sukemori, Yukimori and Arimori fled to the islands.
sen.cmt: 原文と訳文の意味が異なります。
sen.e: In the Amami Islands, there is folklore of fleeing Heike warriors saying that Sukemori, Yukimori and Arimori fled to the islands.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 行盛神社、有盛神社、資盛の大屯神社が祀られ、重要無形民族文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Yukimori-jinja Shrine commemorating Yukimori, Arimori-jinja Shrine commemorating Arimori and Ochon-jinja Shrine commemorating Sukemori are designated as significant intangible folk cultural assets.

Yukimori-jinja Shrine, Arimori-jinja Shrine and Ochon-jinja Shrine are dedicated to Yukimori, Arimori and Sukemori respectively, all of which are designated as Important intangible folk cultural assets.
sen.cmt: 「祀られ」のニュアンスが訳文では足りないと思います。「重要・・」は単語サイトから"important・・"が適当と考えます。
sen.e: Yukimori-jinja Shrine, Arimori-jinja Shrine and Ochon-jinja Shrine are dedicated to Yukimori, Arimori and Sukemori respectively, all of which are designated as Important intangible folk cultural assets.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「諸鈍シバヤ」などの風習も残っている。
sen.e: "Shodon-Shibaya" (traditional entertainment on the grounds of Odon-jinja shrine in Shodon) is one of the customs that continue today.
Shodon-Shibaya' (traditional dance and play that have been handed down in Shodon Village) and other customs still survive.
sen.cmt: 「・・」なので'・・'に，「風習が残る」の訳を替えました。諸鈍シバヤの説明を調べ替えました。
sen.e: Shodon-Shibaya' (traditional dance and play that have been handed down in Shodon Village) and other customs still survive.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
